easy.question: Which band released the hit single “Smells Like Teen Spirit” in 1991?
easy.hint: Kurt Cobain was this band’s singer.

easy.question: What is the capital city of Egypt?
easy.hint: This is easy, so I'll tell you that it ain't Luxor.

easy.question: Which planet is the largest in our Solar System?
easy.hint: Father Zeus!

easy.question: Which Mortal Kombat character is known for his famous catchphrase, 'Get over here!'?
easy.hint: His outfit is black and yellow and he uses a chain to grapple people.

easy.question: Which ocean is the largest on Earth?
easy.hint: The Red Sea is not an ocean. That is all you get.

easy.question: Which of the following countries had a civil war in the 20th century?
easy.hint: The movie 'Pan's Labyrinth' is set in this country during the war.

easy.question: Which of the following guitar brands was not founded by Leo Fender?
easy.hint: G&L stands for George and Leo...

easy.question: Which of the following cartoons did not air on the “Nickelodeon” channel?
easy.hint: It features a dog prominently... not a robot pretending to be a dog.

easy.question: Peanuts are not *actually* nuts... They are _______!
easy.hint: Well, they are not meat.

easy.question: André 3000, member of the rap group Outkast, is know famous for playing which instrument?
easy.hint: While he plays multiple variations of the instrument, they are typically all classified as woodwinds.

easy.question: Which of following is not considered a Romance language?
easy.hint: Romance languages are descended from Latin.

easy.question: As of 2024, how many books from the mainline “A Song of Fire & Ice” series by George R.R. Martin have been released?
easy.hint: Do not include prequels, companion pieces, Elden Ring, or spin-offs.

easy.question: Eric Barone, possibly better known as ConcernedApe, is the creator of which of the following indie video games?
easy.hint: The game is not a platformer.

easy.question: Which of the following vegetables is classified as a nightshade?
easy.hint: While part of it can be green, it is not typically associated with that color.

easy.question: What is my favorite color?
easy.hint: Look around...

easy.question: What temperature does water boil at? Assume you are at sea level and the water is unadulterated. This is not a trick question.
easy.hint: They are both even numbers in Fahrenheit and Celsius.

easy.question: Which of the following shapes does not have four sides?
easy.hint: I can’t help you with this one.

easy.question: Which one of the following metals is liquid at room temperature?
easy.hint: It is very toxic and was commonly used in thermometers.

easy.question: This class in Dungeons & Dragons enters a state of rage to deal increased damage and gain more resistances.
easy.hint:
I suppose a wizard could enter a state of rage, 
but it strength and melee aren’t really wizard things…

easy.question: Which was the third book in the Harry Potter series of young adult novels?
easy.answer: Harry Potter & The Prisoner of Azkaban
easy.hint: Robert Pattinson did not star in the film adaptation of this book.
options: Harry Potter & The Prisoner of Azkaban
Harry Potter & The Goblet of Fire
Hairy Pothead & The Bong of Malice
Harry Potter & The Transphobic Nitwit Author

easy.question: Which of the following fighting game characters is from Fatal Fury?
easy.hint:
Do not count guest appearances. This character is considered the protagonist of the 
Fatal Fury series and one of SNK’s most iconic characters.

medium.question: This rapper exposed Drake’s hidden son in the diss track “The Story of Adidon”.
medium.hint: He is a member of the rap group 'Clipse' alongside Malice.

medium.question: Which of the following is not an alternate name for a double bass?
medium.hint: The fake name has the word fiddle in it.

medium.question: Who was the author of “Moby-Dick” and “Bartleby, the Scrivener”?
medium.hint: Give you a hint? I would prefer not to.

medium.question: September 11th, 1973 was the date of a CIA-backed coup in which country?
medium.hint: The country is in South America

medium.question: How many notes are in the chromatic scale in music theory?
medium.hint:
Try to visualize a piano keyboard and count 
the number of keys in the repeating pattern.

medium.question: Which ancient Greek city was Oedipus king of?
medium.hint:
The answer is not Athens nor was this city allied 
with Athens in the first Peloponnesian War.

medium.question: Which of the following Chinese dynasties is considered a golden age and is famed for its cosmopolitan culture?
medium.hint: It’s not the Qing Dynasty; consider both parts of the question.

medium.question: Which one of the following jazz albums was made by Herbie Hancock?
medium.hint:
Red Clay is an album by Freddie Hubbard, although he 
also appeared on the Herbie Hancock album in question.

medium.question: Which of the following siege weapons featured a sling to launch projectiles?
medium.hint: A battering ram doesn't really have projectiles, now does it?

medium.question: Who was the killer in the 1980 horror film “Friday the 13th”?
Does Dumbledore die? Does Gollum die? Is Tenet a mediocre movie at best?
medium.hint: Look, Tenet being mediocre had nothing to do with that poor cast.

medium.question: Is this game scary?
medium.hint: Scary is not a euphemism for bad.

medium.question: Umami is the Japanese word for which of the five specific tastes?
medium.hint:
Examples of umami foods include meat, fish sauce, mushrooms, 
and the god particle known as MSG.

medium.question: Which of the following metals is actually magnetic?
medium.hint: Pawn shops typically test jewelry with a magnet to check authenticity.

medium.question: Which node became deprecated in Godot 4.3?
medium.hint:
The replacement is basically the same thing, 
but more in line with how things typically work in Godot.

medium.question: Which of the following languages is most classifiable as a Functional Programming language?
medium.hint:
All of these languages at least borrow from FP, but one is 
predominantly functional in paradigm. It isn't pure, though...

hard.question: Which US President entered Spanish occupied Florida  while chasing the Seminole peoples, leading to the U.S. taking over Florida?
hard.hint:
This event happened before his Presidency and 
was not approved by Spain or the U.S. government initially.

hard.question: Which movie features a woman in a radiator singing, 'In Heaven, everything is fine'?
hard.hint: The film was directed by David Lynch and was released in 1977.

hard.question: Which of the following is the name of a confirmed and provably real CIA operation?
hard.hint:
There's a red herring in there. Everything is 
spelled correctly and the words matter.

hard.question: In chemistry, chirality is used to describe asymmetry of molecules. What does the greek root it is derived from mean?
hard.hint: Think about what chirality is describing.

hard.question: Which species of animal is featured in the painting 'Man Proposes, God Disposes'?
hard.hint: The painting depicts an awful ship wreck.

hard.question: Which country in the Americas was the first to follow the Unite States in gaining independence from it's European colonizer?
hard.hint:
They were not supported by the USA and it 
should not be surprising why that's the case.

hard.question: The movie 'A Fistful of Dollars' is essentially a remake of which Akira Kurosawa film?
hard.hint:
I'll rule out Ran for you. 
That's an adaptation of 'King Lear'.

hard.question: Which of the following plays was written by Eugène Ionesco?
